intro: Psittacanthus corderoi, commonly known as the Cordero’s spiky fern, is a unique plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiky fronds that give it a striking appearance. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical forests. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are located on the underside of its leaves, typical of many fern species. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant.
